Name: Working Memory and Reward in Adults
ReferencesAndLinks: Hammer R, Cooke GE, Stein MA & Booth JR (2015). Functional neuroimaging of visuospatial working memory tasks enables accurate detection of attention deficit and hyperactivity disorder. Neuroimage – Clinical, 9, 244-252. (PMCID: PMC4576365)

Hammer R, Tennekoon M, Cooke GE, Gayda J, Stein MA & Booth JR (2015). Feedback associated with expectation for larger-reward improves visuospatial working memory performances in children with ADHD. Developmental Cognitive Neuroscience, 14, 38-49. (PMCID: PMC4536089)

Hammer R, Booth JR, Borhani R & Katsaggelos AK (Feb. 25, 2020).  Pattern analysis based on fMRI data collected while subjects perform working memory tasks allowing high-precision diagnosis of ADHD. US10571539B2.
HowToAcknowledge:
Please cite this dataset as well as the corresponding data descriptor for use of this dataset:

Lytle MN, Hammer R & Booth JR (2020). Working memory and reward in adults. OpenNeuro. 10.18112/openneuro.ds002687

Lytle MN, Hammer R & Booth JR (2020). A neuroimaging dataset on working memory and reward processing in children with and without ADHD. Data in Brief, 28,105801.
